column4: When I tried to install it using apt I got the message mozilla-dev has no release candidate and they suggested that I install libnspr-dev instead. I did, but the error remained. Does anyone know what I might try?
type in a terminal - sudo apt-get install mozilla-dev
do you have all the repos enabled?

I tried that and got: The package is not available but another package refers to it. This package might replace it: libnspr-dev. Mozilla-dev has no release candidate (rough translation from the actual Swedish messages i got)
can anyone help me with what I said a while ago? -

can someone tell me how to build raid arrays (mdadm)? I have a single hard drive (80 GB) from weston digital. I am using 7.04 (testing), and there seems to be some problem with raid arrays in mdadm, causing initramfs-tools to fall back to emergency procedures. while i am able to boot with these kernels, the boot process is very slow, login takes a lot of time, and hard drive activity causes a lot of cpu usage
No I haven't enabled any non-default repos. How do I do that?
the package is in the universe repositories
type in a terminal - gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
then uncomment (remove #) the lines that say universe
you'll need to do a sudo apt-get update before you can inatall mozilla-dev
It still does not work. It says mozilla-dev has no release candidate.
I suppose I could just download it and install it myself.
you'll need to do a sudo apt-get update before you can inatall mozilla-dev
